{"blocks":[{"key":"dg66o","text":"Optional step: If you wish you can check the DNA concentration of your reactions before proceeding, to determine successful amplification (or failure in the case of the negative control). If you are processing many samples, to save time, you can check the concentration of a few samples to check amplification success. In our experience, reactions are typically around 80-100ng/μL. If your samples are \u003c50ng/μL you can double the amount used in the next step.
